stories.text:
A month ago I started a SDE internship at a medium company, this is my first time working with code at a company.
When I look at existing company code, nothing has any kind of comments, it makes it really hard to understand the code because of all the internal tools and acronyms that are not explained anywhere.
And, in my PR reviews I am told to delete my comments to my code before I push it, even for the initial self project that they set me to do and which will only be used by me and my manager.
Is it normal to not use comments in a company?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is it normal to not have comments in a company's code?
You can‘t take the Bar exam if your laptop is too modern

stories.text: I've accumulated several old hard drives, either replacing with bigger capacity ones, or replacing ones that started showing SMART errors about potential data loss. Any suggestions for a creative uses, like building free public web server with caveat that data will be lost? And if I went with recycling, how to ensure that whole data is erased?
stories.title: Ask HN: What to do with old hard drives?
